result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon K. Shields

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
1:50 PM Court calls  22CF49, 21CM134 & 22CF109@  1:50 pm. Defendant Brandon K. Shields in court.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court for Brandon K. Shields.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. AIA for 22 Cases.  Atty Laufenberg has copy of complaint on new case, waives reading and waives time limits for p.h. Def. waives time limits for p.h.  Court accepts waiver of time limits for p.h.  Waiver is for 22CF49 & 22CF109. Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

2:05 PM Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court with Elizabeth Gebert, via zoom.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court, via zoom for Brandon K. Shields. Felony cases set for AIA and 21CM134 set for Status.  22CF49 Court will allow approve court appointed and no more money need to be set down but just would like court appointed form completed. Atty Laufenberg makes statement.  Atty Launberg will take all cases.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. No contact with alleged victim.

03:59 PM Defendant Brandon K. Shields in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon K. Shields appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty.  State is complied with victim rights.  State gives bail/bond recommendation, $3,000.00 cash bond with conditions   Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. No contact with victim. Def. heard on bond.  Court gives 3 factors orders $2500 cash bond with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. No contact with victim.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
